divs: sighting detailsi was out for my nightly walk with my dog around 8 p.m. on wednesday, october 24. it was a clear night; i looked up to check out the sky and saw an unusual object that had flown overhead and was heading south. the object had four pinkish-red lights in two rows of two with 12-16 smaller pale blue lights around the perimeter. i couldn���t hear any sound from the object but i was near a busy road and there was a lot of traffic noise. it was traveling at a speed that would be consistent with a small, single engine plane. however, there were no navigation, strobe, or landing lights on the object. since it was nighttime, i would only be guessing at its size and altitude--my impression was that the object was somewhere around ten feet by ten feet, and that its altitude was 800--1000 feet. still, i thought i was looking at a small plane with some kind of light display attached, and i expected it to bank to the east for a landing approach to kent county international airport (the street i live on is directly along the west\east landing approach), at which point i would be able to see its navigation lights. instead, the object made a sharp turn to the west and as it came out of the turn there was a flash of green light, and the red and blue lights disappeared. i waited several minutes to see if the object would return, but it did not. duration of the sighting was 30-40 seconds.
Summary: Object/unusual lights, four red lights in two rows surrounded by smaller blue lights
trends: There have been 5 other sightings in Wyoming
There were no other sightings in Wyoming on or around October 24th 2012
